TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE Municipal State Attorney ’s ORG ( Općinsko državno odvjetništvo u GPE ) indicted the applicant in ORG ( PERSON kazneni sud u GPE ) on charges of failing to pay child maintenance for his CARDINAL children .

CARDINAL . At a hearing on DATE the applicant pleaded not guilty and decided to remain silent and to not give any evidence . The judge conducting the proceedings informed the applicant of his obligation to inform the court if he were to move or change his place of residence . She also informed the applicant of the legal consequences if he failed to comply with this obligation , CARDINAL of which was that the judgment could be placed on the court ’s public noticeboard .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a judgment by which it found the applicant guilty of failing to pay child maintenance for one child but acquitted him of the same charge in respect of the other child . The applicant was sentenced to CARDINAL months’ imprisonment , suspended for DATE on the condition that he compensate the injured party by paying the maintenance due within DATE . The judge conducting the proceedings publicly pronounced the judgment and informed the applicant of his right to appeal within DATE after he received a written copy of the judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered that the judgment be served on the parties .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG received a notice from the post office informing that court that the service of the judgment on the applicant had been unsuccessful . Service had been attempted on DATE , DATE and DATE but nobody had answered at the applicant ’s address . CARDINAL notices of attempted delivery had also been left for the applicant but he had never contacted the post office .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered that service of the judgment was to be executed through the court ’s delivery service .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s children lodged an appeal with ORG ( Županijski sud u GPE ) against the first - instance judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE a notice from the court ’s delivery service was submitted to the judge conducting the proceedings informing her that service of the judgment on the applicant had remained unsuccessful . Service had been attempted on DATE , CARDINAL DATE , DATE and DATE but without success . The applicant ’s address had been visited in the morning and the evening and notices of attempted delivery had also been left for him but it had been impossible to serve the judgment on him .

CARDINAL . The judge conducting the proceedings ordered that the judgment be placed on the court ’s public noticeboard . On an unspecified date in DATE the judgment was placed on the public noticeboard and after DATE it was presumed that the judgment had been served on the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was served with the appeal lodged by his children against the judgment of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted written observations in respect of the appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal by the applicant ’s children and upheld the first - instance judgment , as a result of which it became final .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judgment of ORG was served on the applicant . On DATE the applicant consulted and copied the case file of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG opened proceedings for revocation of the applicant ’s suspended sentence because he had failed to comply with the conditions set out in the judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a request with ORG asking that the stamped certificate stating that the judgment had become final be revoked on the grounds that the judgment had never been served on him . On an unspecified date he also lodged a request for the reopening of the proceedings , which was rejected by ORG on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint with ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) , complaining that ORG had never decided on his request for the stamped certificate stating that the judgment had become final to be revoked . On DATE ORG declared the applicant ’s complaint inadmissible on the ground that the impugned decisions were not susceptible for the constitutional review .
CARDINAL . At the time , the relevant provisions of LAW ( Zakon o kaznenom postupku , ORG nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , DATE , CARDINAL , CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) provided :

“ ( CARDINAL ) A court shall grant reinstatement to the prior state of affairs in order to file an appeal to a defendant who , for justifiable reasons , fails within a prescribed term to file an appeal against a judgment or a ruling on security or educational measures or on the confiscation of a monetary benefit , provided that the defendant submits a petition for reinstatement to the prior state of affairs within DATE following the removal of the cause of his failure to act within the term and that , at the same time as the petition , he lodges an appeal ...
( CARDINAL ) After a lapse of DATE from the date of failure , no petition for reinstatement to the prior state of affairs may be submitted . ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) Decisions and other documents shall as a rule be served by mail . Service may also be effected by an official of the authority which has rendered the decision or directly by such authority .

( CARDINAL ) If a party has not reported a change of address to a court or if the party can not be reached at the address that was previously given to the court or it is evident that he is evading receipt of a decision that is subject to appellate review other than a judgment imposing a sentence of imprisonment , the court shall put the decision on the court ’s public notice board . After the lapse of the term of appeal the decision shall become final . ”

( CARDINAL ) An indictment and a judgment or other decision for which the term of appeal begins to run when service occurs shall be served in person on a defendant who does not have defence counsel . Upon the defendant ’s request , a judgment or other decision shall be served on a person designated by him .

( CARDINAL ) If , with the exception of a judgment referred to in DATE , a decision or an appeal by the adverse party which is served for reply can not be served on a defendant because he has not reported a change of address or if it is evident that he is evading receipt of the decision , the court shall put the decision or the appeal on the court ’s public noticeboard and after the lapse of DATE it shall be deemed duly served .

( CARDINAL ) If a defendant who does not have defence counsel is served with a judgment imposing a sentence of imprisonment and this judgment can not be served at his present address , the court shall assign defence counsel to the defendant , who shall perform this duty until the new address of the defendant is determined . ... ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) When a defendant is examined for the first time , he shall be asked for his first name and surname ... The defendant shall be instructed that he is bound to appear upon a summons and to notify the court immediately of changes of his address , as well as of any intention to change his place of residence , and shall be warned of the consequences of failure to comply . ”
